definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Going into the tana away, west mother forbade it, get rid of him.
sentences.chinese: 塔納要闖進去帶走帕萊，西瓦母親不允，趕走了他。

sentences.english: Brown tried all ways to get rid of Steelman, but he couldn't do it.
sentences.chinese: 布朗用盡一切辦法想趕走斯蒂爾曼，但都沒成功。

sentences.english: Abruptly he Sat. upright in his chair and, with an effort of will, expunged his downcast mood.
sentences.chinese: 突然，他在椅子上直起身來，努力趕走沮喪的情緒。

sentences.english: Why alienate half of your potential investors?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼要趕走一半的潛在投資者呢？

sentences.english: The National Socialists ousted him from his position as mayor of the city of Cologne.
sentences.chinese: 國家社會主義黨把他從科龍市長的地位趕走。

sentences.english: Some kinds of animals can whisk flies away with their tails.
sentences.chinese: 某些動物會用它們的尾巴趕走蒼蠅。

sentences.english: Night after night, however, I was woken up and told to move along by security guards or the police.
sentences.chinese: 但夜復一夜，我還是數次被保安或警察叫醒並趕走。

sentences.english: The insurgents blow up railway tracks, seize land and chase away forest guards.
sentences.chinese: 起義者炸燬了鐵軌，奪去了土地，趕走了森林警衛。

sentences.english: It’s St Peter’s, whom your fathers chased away.
sentences.chinese: 這城池是聖彼得的，你們的父輩將他從這裏趕走。

sentences.english: The police moved the crowd on before it could get big enough to threat law and order.
sentences.chinese: 警察趕走了人羣，以防聚集太多而滋生事端。

sentences.english: Small grand drives away Xiao Ya instantly, live together with big house rise.
sentences.chinese: 小浩立即趕走肖雅，與大宇同居起來。

sentences.english: We shooed them away and went back to bed.
sentences.chinese: 我們將它們趕走後，就回去睡覺了。

sentences.english: The room into what he said no evidence, but also called security out of show.
sentences.chinese: 房成卻說何秀沒有證據，還叫來了保安趕走何秀。

sentences.english: You’d wear daisies in your hair and I’d chase away the hornets.
sentences.chinese: 你在頭上插滿雛菊，我趕走大黃蜂。

sentences.english: How did you drive him away?
The landlady turned out a tenant for not paying the rent .
sentences.chinese: 女房東趕走了一名不交房租的房客。

definition: to handle/to deal with/to cope/to get by with
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
to put an end to/to annihilate/to cause to perish/to perish/annihilation (in quantum field theory)
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
